q: How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.
h:
“How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.” —
Jack Butcher

q: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
h:
“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.” —
Walt Disney

q: Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.
h:
“Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: You are always your own best guru, your own best teacher, the answers are always inside you.
h:
“You are always your own best guru, your own best teacher, the answers are always inside you.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.
h:
“Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Remain calm. Be kind.
h:
“Remain calm. Be kind.” —
Colin Powell

q: The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it.
h:
“The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it.” —
Carl Jung

q: Consider the rights of others before your own feelings, and the feelings of others before your own rights.
h:
“Consider the rights of others before your own feelings, and the feelings of others before your own rights.” —
John Wooden

q: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
h:
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.
h:
“Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.
h:
“Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.” —
Gary Keller

q: Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.
h:
“Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Do not be so open-minded that your brains fall out.
h:
“Do not be so open-minded that your brains fall out.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
h:
“We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.
h:
“Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Life must be rich and full of loving-it's no good otherwise, no good at all, for anyone.
h:
“Life must be rich and full of loving-it's no good otherwise, no good at all, for anyone. ” —
Jack Kerouac

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
h:
“Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
h:
“One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Failure is acceptable. Not trying is a whole different ball park.
h:
“Failure is acceptable. Not trying is a whole different ball park.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
h:
“Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.” —
Bob Marley

q: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
h:
“Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself.
h:
“Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself.” —
Richard Bach

q: If there were no God, there would be no atheists.
h:
“If there were no God, there would be no atheists.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.
h:
“Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
h:
“Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.” —
Henry Ford

q: When the root is strong, the fruit is sweet.
h:
“When the root is strong, the fruit is sweet.” —
Bob Marley

q: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
h:
“It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Force has no place where there is need of skill.
h:
“Force has no place where there is need of skill. ” —
Herodotus

q: Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
h:
“Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company. ” —
George Washington

q: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
h:
“The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.” —
Alan Watts

q: In a world of change, the learners shall inherit the earth, while the learned shall find themselves perfectly suited for a world that no longer exists.
h:
“In a world of change, the learners shall inherit the earth, while the learned shall find themselves perfectly suited for a world that no longer exists.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
h:
“Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.” —
Aristotle

q: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.
h:
“Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.” —
Peter Drucker

q: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
h:
“There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
h:
“Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, expect to win.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: To be able to forget means sanity.
h:
“To be able to forget means sanity.” —
Jack London

q: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.
h:
“You can only be afraid of what you think you know.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
h:
“Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.” —
Criss Jami

q: The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.
h:
“The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.” —
Mark Twain

q: People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.
h:
“Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.” —
Dogen

q: Where words fail, music speaks.
h:
“Where words fail, music speaks.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.
h:
“Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
h:
“Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Investing in yourself is the best investment you will ever make.
h:
“Investing in yourself is the best investment you will ever make.” —
Robin Sharma

q: I was angered, for I had no shoes. Then I met a man who had no feet.
h:
“I was angered, for I had no shoes. Then I met a man who had no feet. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.
h:
“Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.” —
Gary Keller

q: Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.
h:
“Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.” —
Elon Musk
